drupalNodeEvent.title: Roundtable on TaiwanÂ and Indo-Pacific Partnerships: Regional Trends

field_speakers.processed: Sana Hashmi (National Chengchi University), I-wei Jennifer Chang (Global Taiwan Institute), Mike Mochizuki (George Washington University), Deepa Ollapally (George Washington University), Benjamin Hopkins (George Washington University)

field_organizers.processed: Sigur Center for Asian Studies (George Washington University)

field_description.processed: The Indo-Pacific is the most critical region today for global prosperity and security. As the region continues in a state of flux, pivotal states are increasingly recognizing opportunities that Taiwan offers as a partner. Join us for a discussion on how relations are playing out between Taiwan and leading states India, Japan, Australia, and New Zealand, with experts from the US and Asia.
